page_analysis.text_content:
Allowable setback encroachments summary

Feature                                    Allowable encroachment                Code Sec    Illustration
Main dwelling
• 1st floor portion at rear of structure ≤   to within 14' of rear lot line           18.12.050 (a)(2)   Fig 18 on this
  half width of structure                                                                                    page
• 1st floor extension of an existing front    to within 14' of front lot line         18.12.050 (a)(1)(A)  Fig 19 p. 25
  setback encroachment
• 1st floor extension of an existing interior- to within 5' of interior-side           18.12.050 (a)(1)(B)  Fig 19 p. 25
  side setback encroachment                   lot line
• 1st floor extension of an existing street-  to within 10' of street-side            18.12.050 (a)(1)( C)  Fig 19 p. 25
  side setback encroachment                   lot line
• Attached storage closets ≤ 6' in height    4' into front & rear yards & 2' into
  & ≤ 25 sf                                   side yards
Detached accessory structures
• that are 75' from front lot line and 20'   in rear or side yards                    18.12.080 (b)(3)    Fig 34 p. 39
  from street-side lot line
• that are for covered parking and on lots ≤  in rear or side yards
  95' deep and 25' from street-side lot line
  and in rear half of lot
Porches and entry features
• 1st floor balconies, uncovered porches,     6' into front & rear yard &              18.12.050 (a)(3)(D)
  stairways, and fire escapes                 3' into the side yards
• 1st floor only canopies & patio covers     rear or side yards                       18.12.050 (a)(3)(E)
Other
• Eaves & cornices                           2' into side & 4' into front &          18.12.050 (a)(3)(A)
                                             rear yards
• 1st floor bay / greenhouse windows         2' into front yard &                     18.12.050 (a)(3)(B)
  composed of a window surface &              3' into rear yard
  cantilevered with no floor joists
• Greenhouse windows only                     2' into side yards
• Uncovered parking                          in rear or side yards except for        18.12.060 ( c)      Fig 34 p. 39
                                             1st 10' of street side yard
• Pools & spas (not equipment)               to within 6' of rear & interior-side
                                             lot lines
• Fireplaces ≤ 5' wide                       2' into side yard
Excavated features
• Lightwells and stairwells                  3' into side yards & 4' into rear yard  18.12.090 (c)       Fig 39 p. 42
                                             (cumulative length ≤ 15')
• Below grade patios                         2' into side yards & 4' into rear yard                      Fig 40 p. 43
                                             (cumulative length ≤ 5')

24

Allowable rear encroachment

Fig 18 Allowable encroachment: rear yard

Rear yard encroachment
A portion of the main dwelling (no wider than half the max. width of the dwelling), may encroach into the rear setback, at the ground floor only, as follows:
• For all lots, except back-to-back corner lots, up to 6', providing a minimum setback of 14' is maintained.
• For back-to-back corner lots, up to 10', providing a minimum setback of 10' is maintained.

Notes:
• Multiple protrusions are not permitted; addition must be contiguous with existing protrusion.
• Only for legally constructed structures (no variance or an home-improvement exception [HIE]).
• Only once in the life of the structure.

[DIAGRAM: Shows a rear yard setback diagram with labels for "Rear yard", "1st story Addition", "Half width of building max", "New OR Existing main dwelling", "Buildable area", "Front yard", and measurements showing "Interior side yard" and "Street side yard". The diagram illustrates setback requirements and allowable encroachment areas.]

visual_elements.description: Comprehensive table showing allowable setback encroachments with columns for Feature, Allowable encroachment, Code Sec, and Illustration. Contains multiple categories including Main dwelling, Detached accessory structures, Porches and entry features, Other, and Excavated features.
visual_elements.location: Left side of page, spanning most of the page height

visual_elements.description: Technical diagram labeled 'Fig 18 Allowable encroachment: rear yard' showing a bird's eye view of a property lot with main dwelling, addition area, setback requirements, and yard designations. Shows measurements and allowable encroachment zones with dashed lines indicating setback boundaries.
visual_elements.location: Right side of page, middle to bottom section

additional_notes: Page number 24 appears at bottom left
Multiple code section references throughout the table
Figure references to other pages (Fig 19 p. 25, Fig 34 p. 39, Fig 39 p. 42, Fig 40 p. 43)

qualifiers.text: 1st floor portion at rear of structure ≤ half width of structure
Attached storage closets ≤ 6' in height & ≤ 25 sf
that are 75' from front lot line and 20' from street-side lot line
that are for covered parking and on lots ≤ 95' deep and 25' from street-side lot line and in rear half of lot
1st floor bay / greenhouse windows composed of a window surface & cantilevered with no floor joists
For all lots, except back-to-back corner lots
A portion of the main dwelling (no wider than half the max. width of the dwelling), may encroach into the rear setback, at the ground floor only
Only for legally constructed structures (no variance or an home-improvement exception [HIE])
Only once in the life of the structure
Multiple protrusions are not permitted; addition must be contiguous with existing protrusion

conditions.text: to within 14' of rear lot line
4' into front & rear yards & 2' into side yards
2' into front yard & 3' into rear yard
3' into side yards & 4' into rear yard
2' into side yards & 4' into rear yard
up to 6', providing a minimum setback of 14' is maintained
up to 10', providing a minimum setback of 10' is maintained

logical_relationships.expression: 1st floor portion at rear of structure ≤ half width of structure AND to within 14' of rear lot line
Attached storage closets ≤ 6' in height & ≤ 25 sf AND 4' into front & rear yards & 2' into side yards
For all lots, except back-to-back corner lots AND up to 6', providing a minimum setback of 14' is maintained
For back-to-back corner lots AND up to 10', providing a minimum setback of 10' is maintained

execution_sequence.action: Determine lot type (back-to-back corner or other)
Verify structure is legally constructed with no variance or HIE
Confirm this is the first and only encroachment in structure's life
Apply appropriate encroachment limits based on lot type
